name: py-pyautogui

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
PyAutoGUI lets your Python scripts control the mouse and keyboard to
automate interactions with other applications.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pymsgbox
dependencies.description:
A simple, cross-platform, pure Python module for JavaScript-like message
boxes.

dependencies.name: py-pytweening
dependencies.description: A collection of tweening / easing functions implemented in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pyscreeze
dependencies.description:
PyScreeze can take screenshots, save them to files, and locate images
within the screen. This is useful if you have a small image of, say, a
button that needs to be clicked and want to locate it on the screen.

dependencies.name: py-pygetwindow
dependencies.description:
A simple, cross-platform module for obtaining GUI information on and
controlling application's windows.

dependencies.name: py-mouseinfo
dependencies.description:
An application to display XY position and RGB color information for the
pixel currently under the mouse. Works on Python 2 and 3. This is useful
for GUI automation planning.

dependencies.name: py-python3-xlib
dependencies.description: python3-xlib is python3 version of python-xlib.
